Using a Reasoner
One of the key features of ontologies that are described using
OWL-DL is that they can be processed by a reasoner.
One of the main services offered by a reasoner is to test whether or
One of the main services offered by a reasoner is to test whether or
not one class is a subclass of another class. By performing such
tests on the classes in an ontology it is possible for a reasoner to
compute the inferred ontology class hierarchy.

Inferring Ontology Class Hierarchy
The ontology can be ‘sent to the reasoner’ to automatically
compute the classification hierarchy.
The ‘manually constructed’ class hierarchy is called the asserted hierarchy.
The class hierarchy that is automatically computed by the reasoner is called the inferred
hierarchy.
